name: Sponsoring Manager
description: The Sponsoring Manager is responsible for finding new sponsors and keeping contacts with the present ones. You will have to select companies who could be interested in sponsoring the team, organize meetings with them and draw up sponsoring contracts. As a member of the Logistics Division, other logistics tasks, non concerning the sponsoring field, could be assigned to the Sponsoring Manager if necessary.
desirable: Communication skills
Good writing skills in both Italian and English
Teamwork skills
Resourcefulness
Flexibility

name: Facility Manager
description: The Facility Manager would be responsible for the inventory management system. You will have to keep track of all the materials and equipment that enter or leave the laboratory. You will also have to make sure that anyone who needs to access the laboratory or other DIMEAS rooms has the proper habilitation, and keep track of the accesses. As a member of the Logistics Division, other logistics tasks, non concerning the facilities and inventory management, could be assigned to the Facility Manager if necessary.
desirable: Experience in inventories management
Attention to details

name: Events Specialist
description: The Operational Excellence Specialist is responsible for the GANNT chart of the team, using Microsoft Project. You will have to check the meeting minutes of the divisions you will be asked to support, and keep the chart updated. As a member of the Logistics Division, other logistics tasks, non concerning the GANNT, could be assigned to the Events Specialist if necessary.
desirable: Communication skills
Teamwork skills
Resourcefulness
Flexibility
Proactivity
required: Intermediate / advanced knowledge of both English and Italian

name: Operational Excellence Specialist
description: The Operational Excellence Specialist is responsible for the GANNT chart of the team, using Microsoft Project. You will have to check the meeting minutes of the divisions you will be asked to support, and keep the chart updated. As a member of the Logistics Division, other logistics tasks, non concerning the GANNT, could be assigned to the Events Specialist if necessary.
desirable: Experience with Microsoft Project (not required, but highly recommended)
Communication skills
Teamwork skills
Flexibility and availability

name: Graphic Designer
description: As a Graphic Designer, you will be in charge of designing the Team’s mission patches and logos, and help design the external coating of the Team’s rockets. You will design social media posts and website UI & UX in tight collaboration with photographers, video makers, rendering specialists, and web developers, leveraging modern design styles and patterns.
desirable: Attention to details and being up to date on the latest trends
Experience in design motion graphics (charts, lower-thirds, GIFs, Animations, animated social media ads)
Intermediate English writing skills
required: Knowledge of prototyping softwares and graphics softwares
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite Professional products,such as Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere, and InDesign, or similar

name: Social Media Manager
description: PoliTo Rocket Team is looking for one or more Social Media Manager(s), who will have the responsibility to maintain and enhance the team’s image by implementing social media platforms’ content strategies.

This role will be required to run advertising campaigns and drive engagement by creating high-quality original content. The manager(s) should also oversee our community by managing interactions across all platforms.
desirable: Knowledge of the main social media platforms used by the Team (Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter) and of additional social media platform to expand the Team's presence
Attention to details and being up to date on the latest trends
Previous experience in the media management and previous experience with paid content promotions
Experience in design motion graphics (charts, lower-thirds, GIFs, Animations, animated social media ads)
Proficiency with graphic design software such as Canva, Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere, and InDesign, or similar

name: Video Maker
description: The Video Maker(s) will be responsible for designing, editing and producing video content for our earned media, website and social media channels. This position requires to remain flexible and adaptable, have strong planning skills and participate in many aspects of the Team’s daily work. The Video Maker will work in close collaboration with the Photographer(s) and Social Media Manager.

It is very important to us to document every aspect of the Team’s operations. Hence, it will be needed to be present during the Team’s testing campaigns and launches, and take the best shots for the Team’s public appearance. It will be needed to film our members during their daily work and document the project's progress.
desirable: Experience in photography and photo editing
Skilled at working and communicating with both technical and non-technical staff
Attention to details and up to date on the latest trends
Intermediate English writing skills
required: Experience in Video Design or related field
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite Professional products,such as Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere, and InDesign, or similar

name: Photographer
description: The Photographer(s) will be responsible for producing and editing photographic content for our earned media, website and social media channels. This position requires to remain flexible and adaptable, have strong planning skills and participate in many aspects of the Team’s daily work. The Photographer(s) will work in close collaboration with the Video Maker(s) and Social Media Manager.

It is very important for the Team to document every public appearance. The Photographer(s) presence will be needed at every team event, mission and launch. The Photographer(s) will be asked to take the best shots during each event, in order to promote the image of the Team.
desirable: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite Professional products,such as Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere, and InDesign, or similar
Skilled at working and communicating with both technical and non-technical staff
Attention to details and up to date on the latest trends
Intermediate English writing skills
required: Experience in photography and photo editing

name: Web Developer
description: The role of the web developer is to manage the website in all its aspects, in order to present the team at its best. In particular, you will work with web technologies (SCSS, TypeScript, Svelte, Supabase) to design, create, and maintain all the website sections, based on the team directives.
Mid term tasks could be:
Improve the projects page
Create page transition effects
Enhance the overall user experience and interactions with better animations and with 3D models

A relatively big future project is the development of a backend that handles recruitment, renders pages based on information from (admin) lead engineers, and possibly receives and stores data collected during flights.
desirable: Knowledge of SCSS
Knowledge of TypeScript
Previous experience with Git and GitHub
Previous experience with Svelte & SvelteKit
Knowledge and previous use of the Three.js library
Basic knowledge of Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA)

name: Software Engineer (Mission Analysis)
description: We're looking for software engineers to join our team. Your job would involve developing scripts for studying rocket trajectories and improving aerodynamics. Additionally, you'll create a virtual model to simulate rocket behavior in various scenarios. This will involve selecting appropriate physical models and parameters to represent the rocket's propulsion, aerodynamics, and control systems. Furthermore the created model must ensure that the simulation is accurate and that it can be used to analyze the rocket's performance.  The basic features of this model shall include:
6 degree of freedom flight simulation
Realtime simulated altitude, velocity and acceleration display
Aerodynamic models
Solid motors models
Future software features shall include:
Accurate weather modeling
Automatic design optimization
Parachutes with external trigger functions
desirable: Knowledge of fluid dynamics and aerodynamics
Mastery of Matlab/Simulink
Basic knowledge of CFD software
Previous experience in GUI development
required: Knowledge of a programming language suitable for performant scientific computing and numerical calculation, such as Python or Matlab/Simulink
Knowledge of existing tools, libraries, or resources on flight simulation

name: Recovery Engineer
description: Everything that comes up, must eventually come down, hopefully without creating a crater. You'll be able to help develop and validate Cavour's parachutes deployment and recovery systems in collaboration with other division members.

Every system and subsystem will have to be extensively tested on the ground before flight, to verify their reliability. Thus, small scale tests of a single component and extensive full scale tests of the whole recovery system will be performed. Your main objective will be to ensure the successful recovery and reusability of rocket components.
desirable: Experience in handling and sewing synthetic fibers such as kevlar
Possession of a firearm license
Experience and knowledge with explosives and/or gases
required: Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: CAD & Additive manufacturing Engineer
description: The main role of the CAD & Additive Manufacturing Engineer is to design components of the rocket with CAD software, iterating on their design based on the analysis conducted by the other members of the Aerostructures Division. The job will also involve geometry optimization for additive manufacturing of some components and support to their production with 3D printing.
CAD Engineers of the Cavour subteam might also work on projects managed by other subteams, related to propulsion or payloads.
desirable: Experience with 3D printing and knowledge of slicer softwares
Experience with topology optimisation/generative design softwares
Basic knowledge of LaTeX
Experience with carbon fiber lamination methods
Proficiency with blender or other rendering softwares
required: Knowledge of a CAD Software (preferably Solidworks or Fusion 360)
Basic/Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: Hardware Engineer
description: As an Hardware Engineer in the Avionics division, you will design, prototype and manufacture the electronic systems for both the rocket and the ground station, starting from scratch. You will use CAD tools to create electrical schemes that will be converted into circuits and PCBs. Your main tasks will include optimizing and enhancing our first discrete flight computer by adding new features, ensuring safety and reliability, and designing the next-generation flight computer, a single-board integrated solution that uses STM32 microcontrollers. You will also conduct practical work, such as research, reading datasheets, design, simulations, soldering, testing and debugging. Projects will be developed in close cooperation with other division members. Please be informed that your work will be entirely voluntary.  As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
desirable: Prior experience with microcontrollers
Familiarity with hardware testing and debugging tools
Familiarity with PCB CAD softwares (e.g. KiCAD)
Good interdisciplinary communication skills
required: Knowledge in circuit theory and electronics
Basic/Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: Embedded Software Engineer
description: As an Embedded Software Engineer, your job will be the development and optimization of the first flight computer software, and you will also take part in the initial design phase for the next-generation flight computer, built in the STM32 platform. You will write sensors’ drivers and high-quality structured software for the embedded processor in order to retrieve and transmit data, control actuators and accomplish specific mission tasks. This will involve extensive research, writing, testing and debugging. Projects will be developed in close cooperation with other division members. As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
desirable: Knowledge of flight computer software architecture and design patterns
Experience with software testing and verification tools
Experience with STM32 platform
Good interdisciplinary communication skills
required: General knowledge of embedded systems and microcontrollers
Experience with software development tools such as IDEs, compilers, debuggers and version control
Basic/Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: Software Engineer (Ground Station)
description: Altitude, orientation, speed, and most importantly for recovery, GPS location sent by the rocket during flight and retrieved by ground antennas must be processed, displayed, and saved in real time.As a ground station software engineer, your job will be to develop a desktop application with a logical, neat, and aesthetic structure that can perform the tasks mentioned above. This task involves interacting with all the different avionics systems, so communication protocols play a critical role. Projects will be developed in close collaboration with other division members. As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
desirable: Prior experience with desktop applications and GUI development using a tech stack and graphics libraries of your choice
Experience with data processing and visualization tools
Experience with embedded systems and hardware interfaces
Good interdisciplinary communication skills
required: Knowledge of software engineering principles and practices
Familiarity with communication protocols and interfaces
Basic/Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: RF Specialist
description: Wireless communication plays a fundamental role before, during, and after the flight. It allows the ground station to monitor system status and evaluate potential risks, transmit data in real time to track the rocket's altitude, speed, and other critical parameters, and facilitate recovery by communicating the rocket's GPS location. Due to its critical importance, our team needs a specialized engineer to design, simulate, and develop the rocket-ground station communication system at the physical layer. The role will involve extensive research, investigation of technologies and protocols, and positioning and pointing of ground and onboard antennas to optimize data transmission. Projects will be developed in close collaboration with other division members. As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
desirable: Familiarity with communication protocols such as ZigBee, LoRa and Wi-Fi
Prior experience with embedded systems
Experience with embedded systems and hardware interfaces
Good interdisciplinary communication skills
required: Knowledge in circuit theory and electronics
Knowledge of wireless communication principles and technologies
Basic/Intermediate English writing and speaking skills

name: CFD Analyst / Aerodynamics Engineer
description: The role of the CFD Analyst / Aerodynamics Engineer is to study aerodynamic shape of the rocket with a trade off between manufacturing, structures and reliability. The job involves aerodynamic configuration development including aerosurface and aerodynamic control surface design. You will study aerodynamic loads, performance, stability and aerothermal analysis at multiple fidelity levels including empirical sizing methods, shock & impact methods, and CFD. You will work with CFD setup, analysis, and post-processing of inviscid and viscous flow simulations. Please be informed that your work will be entirely voluntary. As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
Example of practical works to do in the near future are:
CFD analysis of the rocket’s nosecone
Launch stability
Transonic studies
desirable: Knowledge of aerodynamic fundamentals
Knowledge of CFD software: ANSA, STARC++, OpenFoam, ANSYS fluent or others
Knowledge of computational fluid dynamics theory
Experience with aerodynamic design and optimization
Experience in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD)
Experience with data visualization software
Experience with scientific computing and scripting languages
required: Interest in aerospace and fluid dynamics

name: FEM Analyst / Structural Engineer
description: The role of the FEM Analyst / Structural engineer is to study rocket stiffness and strength in order to remain within the displacement and stress limits to avoid catastrophic breaks. All those objectives are followed both by analytical and numerical analysis. The job is responsible for performing detailed analysis of advanced composite and metallic structure using classical hand calculations and FE tools to develop high performance airframe structures. As we are a student team of Politecnico di Torino, we do not offer any paid employment.
Example of practical works to do in the near future are:
Buckling study of the rocket’s airframe bodytube
Frequency response of the structures
desirable: Experience on static structural analysis
Knowledge and autonomous use of analysis and simulation tools such as Ansys, Nastran or similar
Understanding and interpretation of analysis results
Mesh generation capabilities
required: Interest in structures behaviour and FEM method
